ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: We learned a lot of grammar (especially future tense) and lots of new vocab. We also got to listen to Israeli music and watch an Israeli TV show.
We built upon the skills of L1 and L2 like reading and writing in Hebrew. We continued to work on past tense and learned future tense.
Learned many new vocab words and improved my grammar. I can now speak several sentences at a time and can understand when natives speak Hebrew.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Strengths: Well organized, fun class, kind professor, definitely felt like I was learning a lot every day Weaknesses: Sometimes too much homework (since it meets every day), also there is only one midterm and one final which makes them stressful

The course is great. The only weakness is that the way of learning new vocabulary could be a little more organized. But anyway this course focuses more on grammar and generally being able to understand and speak than just new vocab.
Strengths - small class size, lots of individual attention, expectations are fair, really improve Hebrew Weakness - disorganized at times, difficult, lots of grammar

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, I would. If you put in the work, you can do well. Some people including myself complained about the workload at some points, but the actual work isn't that hard and Shiri and all the TAs were very helpful and will answer your questions. I feel like I learned a lot and I really loved everyone in my class -- it was really fun.
Yes definitely! The Hebrew program is probably one of the best language programs at Yale. There is so much support.
Yes - it is a good class to take if you want to improve your Hebrew
